etymology.description: semantic: 日 “sun” + phonetic: 棗 (sometimes simplified as 朿); early bronze form was a pictogram “acorn,” original of 皂, borrowed phonetically for “morning.”
etymology.interpretation: Earliest forms drew an acorn, which belonged to 皂 and lent its sound to write the meaning ‘morning/early.’ Later standardization combined the sun 日 for meaning with the phonetic 棗 (sometimes reduced to 朿) to indicate pronunciation.

examples.chinese: 早上八点(早上八點)，我们开会(我們開會)。
examples.pinyin: Zǎoshang bā diǎn, wǒmen kāi huì.
examples.english: At 8 in the morning, we have a meeting.

examples.chinese: 他来得太早(他來得太早)，门还没开(門還沒開)。
examples.pinyin: Tā lái de tài zǎo, mén hái méi kāi.
examples.english: He arrived too early; the door hasn’t opened yet.

examples.chinese: 明天早点睡(明天早點睡)，别起得太早(別起得太早)。
examples.pinyin: Míngtiān zǎodiǎn shuì, bié qǐ de tài zǎo.
examples.english: Go to bed earlier tomorrow, and don’t get up too early.
